lemma epigraph_h_min_closedConvexCone_containing_obverse_points {n : } {f : (Fin n ) EReal} (hf_nonneg : x, 0 f x) (hf_closed : ClosedConvexFunction f) (hf0 : f 0 = 0) : let g : (Fin n ) EReal := obverseConvex f let h : (Fin n ) EReal := fun t x => if 0 < t then (t : EReal) * f ((t) x) else if t = 0 then recessionFunction f x else let P : Set (( (Fin n )) ) := {q | h q.1.1 q.1.2 (q.2 : EReal)} (P = closure (P {q | 0 < q.2})) ( K : ConvexCone (( (Fin n )) ), IsClosed (K : Set (( (Fin n )) )) ( (lam : ) (x : Fin n ), g x (lam : EReal) ((lam, x), (1 : )) (K : Set (( (Fin n )) ))) P (K : Set (( (Fin n )) ))) := by classical intro g h P refine ?_, ?_ simpa [h, P] using (P_eq_closure_P_inter_mu_pos (f := f) hf_nonneg hf_closed hf0) intro K hKclosed hK simpa [g, h, P] using (P_subset_any_closed_convexCone_containing_obverse_points (f := f) hf_nonneg hf_closed hf0 (K := K) hKclosed hK)
/- Theorem 15.4: Let `f` be a nonnegative convex function on `` such that `f 0 = 0`. Then its polar `f` is a nonnegative closed convex function with `f 0 = 0`, and the bipolar satisfies `f = cl f`. In this development, the polar `f` is `polarConvex f` (Text 15.0.29) and `cl f` is `convexFunctionClosure f`. -/

The polar convex function is nonnegative.

lemma polarConvex_nonneg {n : } (f : (Fin n ) EReal) (xStar : Fin n ) : (0 : EReal) polarConvex f xStar := by unfold polarConvex refine le_sInf ?_ intro h exact h.1

The polar convex function vanishes at the origin.

lemma polarConvex_zero {n : } (f : (Fin n ) EReal) : polarConvex f (0 : Fin n ) = 0 := by have hle : polarConvex f (0 : Fin n ) 0 := by unfold polarConvex refine sInf_le ?_ refine le_rfl, ?_ intro x simp have hge : (0 : EReal) polarConvex f (0 : Fin n ) := polarConvex_nonneg f (0 : Fin n ) exact le_antisymm hle hge

Vertical reflection in the last coordinate.

def vertReflect {n : } (p : (Fin n ) ) : (Fin n ) := (p.1, -p.2)

The vertical reflection is an involution.

lemma vertReflect_involutive {n : } : Function.Involutive (vertReflect (n := n)) := by intro p cases p with | mk x => simp [vertReflect]

Product-space polar set using the dot-product-plus-scalar pairing.

def polarSetProd {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : Set ((Fin n ) ) := {y | x C, (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 1}

polarSetProd {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : Set ((Fin n ) )polarSetProd is closed and convex as an intersection of closed halfspaces.

lemma polarSetProd_isClosed_and_convex {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : IsClosed (polarSetProd (n := n) C) Convex (polarSetProd (n := n) C) := by classical have hclosed_half : x : (Fin n ) , IsClosed {y : (Fin n ) | (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 1} := by intro x have hcont1 : Continuous fun y : (Fin n ) => (x.1 y.1 : ) := by simpa using (continuous_dotProduct_const (x := x.1)).comp continuous_fst have hcont2 : Continuous fun y : (Fin n ) => x.2 * y.2 := by simpa using (continuous_const.mul continuous_snd) have hcont : Continuous fun y : (Fin n ) => (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 := hcont1.add hcont2 simpa [Set.preimage, Set.mem_Iic] using (isClosed_Iic.preimage hcont) have hconv_half : x : (Fin n ) , Convex {y : (Fin n ) | (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 1} := by intro x y1 hy1 y2 hy2 a b ha hb hab have hdot : (x.1 (a y1 + b y2).1 : ) = a * (x.1 y1.1 : ) + b * (x.1 y2.1 : ) := by simp [dotProduct_add, dotProduct_smul, smul_eq_mul] have hmul : x.2 * (a y1 + b y2).2 = a * (x.2 * y1.2) + b * (x.2 * y2.2) := by have hmul' : x.2 * (a * y1.2 + b * y2.2) = a * (x.2 * y1.2) + b * (x.2 * y2.2) := by ring calc x.2 * (a y1 + b y2).2 = x.2 * (a * y1.2 + b * y2.2) := by simp [smul_eq_mul] _ = a * (x.2 * y1.2) + b * (x.2 * y2.2) := hmul' have hsum : (x.1 (a y1 + b y2).1 : ) + x.2 * (a y1 + b y2).2 = a * ((x.1 y1.1 : ) + x.2 * y1.2) + b * ((x.1 y2.1 : ) + x.2 * y2.2) := by calc (x.1 (a y1 + b y2).1 : ) + x.2 * (a y1 + b y2).2 = (a * (x.1 y1.1 : ) + b * (x.1 y2.1 : )) + (a * (x.2 * y1.2) + b * (x.2 * y2.2)) := by rw [hdot, hmul] _ = a * ((x.1 y1.1 : ) + x.2 * y1.2) + b * ((x.1 y2.1 : ) + x.2 * y2.2) := by ring have hle1 : a * ((x.1 y1.1 : ) + x.2 * y1.2) a * 1 := mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left hy1 ha have hle2 : b * ((x.1 y2.1 : ) + x.2 * y2.2) b * 1 := mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left hy2 hb have hle : a * ((x.1 y1.1 : ) + x.2 * y1.2) + b * ((x.1 y2.1 : ) + x.2 * y2.2) a * 1 + b * 1 := add_le_add hle1 hle2 have hsum1 : a + b = (1 : ) := by simpa using hab have hle' : (x.1 (a y1 + b y2).1 : ) + x.2 * (a y1 + b y2).2 a + b := by simpa [mul_one, hsum.symm] using hle simpa [hsum1] using hle' have hclosed : IsClosed (polarSetProd (n := n) C) := by simp [polarSetProd, Set.setOf_forall] refine isClosed_iInter ?_ intro i refine isClosed_iInter ?_ intro i_1 refine isClosed_iInter ?_ intro hi exact hclosed_half (i, i_1) have hconv : Convex (polarSetProd (n := n) C) := by simp [polarSetProd, polarSetProd {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : Set ((Fin n ) )polarSetProd is unchanged by taking the closure of the set.

lemma polarSetProd_closure_eq {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : polarSetProd (n := n) (closure C) = polarSetProd (n := n) C := by classical ext y constructor intro hy x hx exact hy x (subset_closure hx) intro hy x hx let H : Set ((Fin n ) ) := {x : (Fin n ) | (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 1} have hsubset : C H := by intro x hxC exact hy x hxC have hclosed : IsClosed H := by have hcont1 : Continuous fun x : (Fin n ) => (x.1 y.1 : ) := by have hcont : Continuous fun x : (Fin n ) => (y.1 x.1 : ) := by simpa using (continuous_dotProduct_const (x := y.1)).comp continuous_fst simpa [dotProduct_comm] using hcont have hcont2 : Continuous fun x : (Fin n ) => x.2 * y.2 := by simpa using (continuous_snd.mul continuous_const) have hcont : Continuous fun x : (Fin n ) => (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 := hcont1.add hcont2 simpa [H, Set.preimage, Set.mem_Iic] using (isClosed_Iic.preimage hcont) have hcl : closure C H := closure_minimal hsubset hclosed exact hcl hx

polarSetProd {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : Set ((Fin n ) )polarSetProd commutes with vertical reflection preimages.

lemma polarSetProd_preimage_vertReflect {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : polarSetProd (n := n) ((vertReflect (n := n)) ' C) = (vertReflect (n := n)) ' (polarSetProd (n := n) C) := by classical ext y constructor intro hy have hy' : vertReflect (n := n) y polarSetProd (n := n) C := by intro x hx have hx' : vertReflect (n := n) x (vertReflect (n := n)) ' C := by simpa [Set.preimage, vertReflect] using hx have hineq := hy (vertReflect (n := n) x) hx' have hrewrite : (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * (-y.2) = (x.1 y.1 : ) + (-x.2) * y.2 := by ring simpa [Set.preimage, vertReflect, hrewrite] using hineq exact hy' intro hy x hx have hx' : vertReflect (n := n) x C := by simpa [Set.preimage, vertReflect] using hx have hineq := hy (vertReflect (n := n) x) hx' simpa [vertReflect, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc] using hineq

A linear functional on the product splits into a dot product and a scalar part.

The dual bipolar set matches the polarSetProd {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : Set ((Fin n ) )polarSetProd bipolar.

lemma bipolar_dualSet_eq_polarSetProd_polarSetProd {n : } (C : Set ((Fin n ) )) : {x : (Fin n ) | polar (E := (Fin n ) ) C, x (1 : )} = polarSetProd (n := n) (polarSetProd (n := n) C) := by classical ext x constructor intro hx y hy let : ((Fin n ) ) [] := { toFun := fun p => (p.1 y.1 : ) + p.2 * y.2 map_add' := by intro p q simp [add_mul, add_left_comm, add_assoc] map_smul' := by intro a p simp [smul_eq_mul, mul_add, mul_left_comm, mul_comm] } have h : polar (E := (Fin n ) ) C := by refine (mem_polar_iff (E := (Fin n ) ) (C := C) ( := )).2 ?_ intro z hz have hineq := hy z hz simpa [] using hineq have hx' : x 1 := hx h simpa [, dotProduct_comm, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc] using hx' intro hx h let y : (Fin n ) := (fun i => (Pi.single i 1, (0 : )), (0, 1)) have hy : y polarSetProd (n := n) C := by intro z hz have hz : z 1 := (mem_polar_iff (E := (Fin n ) ) (C := C) ( := )).1 h z hz have hrepr : z = (z.1 y.1 : ) + z.2 * y.2 := by simpa [y] using (linearMap_eq_dotProduct_add_mul_prod (n := n) z) simpa [hrepr] using hz have hx' : (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 1 := by simpa [dotProduct_comm, mul_comm, mul_left_comm, mul_assoc] using hx y hy have hreprx : x = (x.1 y.1 : ) + x.2 * y.2 := by simpa [y] using (linearMap_eq_dotProduct_add_mul_prod (n := n) x) simpa [hreprx] using hx'
